intro: Babiana plicata, commonly known as the Cape bell or white bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are grass-like and form a rosette at the base, while its stems are short and sturdy. Babiana plicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
